Question/¶

Question contains the implementation of the question.QuestionGenerator class.

question.py¶

This file contains the implementation of the QuestionGenerator class.

class question.QuestionGenerator(prompts=None, img=None, solver=None, constants=[], permute=False, pass_img=True, directions='', sub_topic='')[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that represents a generator object that produces Question objects.

Parameters

  • prompts (str or list, optional) – A list of (or one) parseable strings that represents the question.

  • img (Image, optional) – An image included in the prompt of a generated question.

  • solver (function) – A function applied to the sympy expressions in the prompt that returns an answer. The returned answer can either be sympy/string object, an Image object, or both (in the form of a tuple).

  • constants (list) – A list of Relation instances for each variable to substitute.

  • permute (bool, optional) – A boolean Flag that determines if the expression/equation should be algebraically shuffled (currently only supported over addition)

  • pass_img (bool, optional) – A boolean Flag that determines if img expressions will be passed to the solver. Defaults to True.

  • directions (str, optional) – A latex string that will be shown to the student as instructions for this question.

  • sub_topic (str, optional) – A plain-text string that can be used to categorize questions (outsource this functionality at scale).

nums.py¶

This file contains the implementations of the nums.Relation and nums.Interval classes.

class nums.Relation(var, default_interval=[], expr='')[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that defines a relationship between a given symbol and other symbols in a system.

Parameters

  • var (sympy.core.symbol.Symbol or str) – A sympy object representing the symbol that has a relation.

  • default_interval (Interval) – An Interval instance to default to if the variable passed is determined ‘free’ under the system of relations.

  • expr (str) – A keyword argument that takes a mathematical expression that relates a variable to others in the system.

class nums.Interval(domain, *vals, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that represents numeric intervals in different domains.

Parameters

  • domain (str) – A string representing the parent set of the specified interval. Accepted values: [“Integer”, “Real”, “Natural”, “Rational”, “Finite”]

  • *vals – Intervals for numbers generated

  • **default – A function that takes no arguments and returns a sympy number

  • **zero – determines if 0 is included in the given interval. Defaults to True.

  • **zero – bool, optional

The examples below demonstrate how to represent mathematical intervals using the Interval class.

# This interval will contain integers between -10 and 10 (inclusive).
inter = Interval("Integer", -10, 10)

# You can use the zero keyword to prevent zero from being contained in the interval.
inter = Interval("Integer", -10, 10, zero=False)

# This interval will contain arbitrary floating point numbers between 0 and 1.
inter = Interval("Real", 0, 1)

# Both of these intervals will contain integers between 0 and 100 (inclusive).
inter = Interval("Natural", 0, 100)
inter = Interval("Natural", -100, 100)

# This interval contains rational numbers.
inter = Interval("Rational", -1/2, 1/2)

# This interval only contains the numbers 5, 17, and 32.
inter = Interval("Finite", [5, 17, 32])

# You can use the Finite keyword to make an interval of special angles.
angles = Interval("Finite", [0, sympy.pi / 2, sympy.pi])

# You can also specify the units of an interval (the only option at the moment is degrees).
angles = Interval("Real", 0, 360, units="degrees")

image.py¶

This file contains the implementations of the image.Image and image.Graph classes.

class image.Image[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that can represent an arbitrary image (graphs, tables, or even shapes). Instance variables spelled with a leading underscore are not in the JSON representation.

complete_specified_img()[source]¶

Completes an image where the placeholder values are already specified.

Returns

The completed image, which is ready for rendering.

Return type

Image

complete_template(preprocess_info, substitutions, pass_img)[source]¶

Returns a completed image after using substitutions and returns arguments to be passed to the solver.

Parameters

  • preprocess_info (dict) – A return value of preprocess

  • substitutions –

  • pass_img (bool) – Determines whether we want to pass additional arguments to the solver.

Return type

a tuple of Image, list of sympy objects

json()[source]¶

Returns a json object that contains all the information associated with the Image.

preprocess(*args)[source]¶

Returns an image with its expressions preprocessed, and additional info needed in the complete_image method. Every Image child implements preprocess and complete_template in a way specific to the implementation of the class. The complete_template method relies on the return values of preprocess. See the child documentation for the what preprocess actions are taken.

Return type

tuple of Image and dict

update()[source]¶

Every image object should implement this method if attributes other than it’s expressions must be updated when a question is generated.

class image.Graph(expressions, focus=None, show=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: image.Image

A class that represents plots of equations, piecewise equations, and points. Supports both Cartesian and Polar systems.

Parameters

  • expressions –

  • focus (dict) – A dictionary with three keys: ‘center’, ‘hdisp’, ‘vdisp’. The graph image will be centered at the tuple stored at focus[‘center’], with horizontal displacement focus[‘hdisp’] and vertical displacement focus[‘vdisp’].

  • mode –

  • height –

  • width –

  • preserveAxisNumbers –

  • mathBounds –

  • polarMode –

  • polarNumbers –

  • xAxisStep –
